info.name: PDCM Finder API
info.description:
API to access PDCM Finder data

Patient-derived cancer models (PDCMs) are a powerful oncology research platform for studying tumour biology, mechanisms of drug response and resistance and for testing personalised medicine. Distributed nature of repositories for PDCMs (xenografts, organoids and cell lines) and the use of different metadata standards for describing model''s characteristics make it difficult for researchers to identify suitable PDCM models relevant to specific cancer research questions.

PDCM Finder aims to solve this problem by providing harmonized and integrated model attributes to support consistent searching across the originating resources.

## PostgREST and API usage

We use [PostgREST](https://postgrest.org/en/stable/index.html) to automatically create endpoints from a set of views that define our public API. The resulting endpoints expect a set of operators when using them. These table shows some of them:

| **Abbreviation** | **SQL** | **Meaning** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| eq | `=` | equals |
| gt | `>` | greater than |
| gte | `>=` | greater than or equal |
| lt | `<` | less than |
| lte | `<=` | less than or equal |
| neq | `<>` or `!=` | not equal |
| like | `LIKE` | LIKE operator (to avoid URL encoding you can use \* as an alias of the percent sign % for the pattern) |
| ilike | `ILIKE` | ILIKE operator (to avoid URL encoding you can use \* as an alias of the percent sign % for the pattern) |
| in | `IN` | one of a list of values, e.g. ?a=in.(1,2,3) – also supports commas in quoted strings like ?a=in.("hi,there","yes,you") |
| is | `IS` | checking for exact equality (null,true,false,unknown) |
| not | `NOT` | negates another operator, |
| or | `OR` | logical OR |
| and | `AND` | logical AND |

A complete table and additional documentation about how to use PostgREST can be found [here](https://postgrest.org/en/stable/api.html).

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/model_metadata?model_id=eq.TM01002&data_source=eq.JAX&provider_name=eq.The Jackson laboratory&type=eq.xenograft&host_strain_name=eq.nsg&host_strain_nomenclature=eq.NOD.Cg-Prkdc<sup>scid</sup> Il2rg<sup>tm1Wjl</sup>/SzJ&engraftment_site=eq.Not Provided&engraftment_type=eq.Heterotopic&engraftment_sample_type=eq.Surgical Resection (fragment)&engraftment_sample_state=eq.Not Provided&passage_number=eq.1&histology=eq.Bladder Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma&cancer_system=eq.Urinary System Cancer&primary_site=eq.bladder&collection_site=eq.bladder&tumor_type=eq.Primary&cancer_grade=eq.Grade:low&cancer_grading_system=eq.AJCC&cancer_stage=eq.AJCC 0 - in situ&patient_age=eq.Not specified&patient_sex=eq.male&patient_ethnicity=eq.Not Collected&patient_treatment_status=eq.Not specified&pubmed_ids=eq.PMID: 26270481&europdx_access_modalities=eq.Not Applicable&accessibility=eq.Academia and Industry&contact_name_list=eq.micetech&contact_email_list=eq.micetech@jax.org&contact_form_url=eq.http://tumor.informatics.jax.org/mtbwi/pdxRequest.do?mice=TM01002&source_database_url=eq.http://tumor.informatics.jax.org/mtbwi/pdxDetails.do?modelID=TM01002&select=*&order=model_id.asc&offset=0&limit=10

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)
Host mouse strain name (e.g. NOD-SCID, NSG, etc)
The full nomenclature form of the host mouse strain name
Organ or anatomical site used for the tumour engraftment (e.g. mammary fat pad, Right flank)
Orthotopic: if the tumour was engrafted at a corresponding anatomical site. Hererotopic: If grafted subcuteanously
Description of the type of material grafted into the mouse. (e.g. tissue fragments, cell suspension)
PDX Engraftment material state (e.g. fresh or frozen)
Diagnosis at time of collection of the patient tumor
Site of the primary tumor where primary cancer is originating from (may not correspond to the site of the current tissue sample)
Site of collection of the tissue sample (can be different than the primary site if tumour type is metastatic)
Stage classification system used to describe the stage
Stage of the patient at the time of collection
PubMed ids related to the model
If a model is part of EUROPDX consortium, then this field defines if the model is accessible for transnational access through the EDIReX infrastructure, or only on a collaborative basis
Defines any limitation of access of the model per type of users like academia only, industry and academia, or national limitation
List of names of the contact people for the model
Emails of the contact names for the model
URL to the providers resource for each model
URL to the source database for each model

response.name: Get metadata for a particular model
response.body:
[
    {
        "model_id": "TM01002",
        "data_source": "JAX",
        "provider_name": "The Jackson laboratory",
        "type": "xenograft",
        "host_strain_name": "nsg",
        "host_strain_nomenclature": "NOD.Cg-Prkdc<sup>scid</sup> Il2rg<sup>tm1Wjl</sup>/SzJ",
        "engraftment_site": "Not Provided",
        "engraftment_type": "Heterotopic",
        "engraftment_sample_type": "Surgical Resection (fragment)",
        "engraftment_sample_state": "Not Provided",
        "passage_number": "1",
        "histology": "Bladder Papillary Urothelial Carcinoma",
        "cancer_system": "Urinary System Cancer",
        "primary_site": "bladder",
        "collection_site": "bladder",
        "tumor_type": "Primary",
        "cancer_grade": "Grade:low",
        "cancer_grading_system": "AJCC",
        "cancer_stage": "AJCC 0 - in situ",
        "patient_age": "Not specified",
        "patient_sex": "male",
        "patient_ethnicity": "Not Collected",
        "patient_treatment_status": "Not specified",
        "pubmed_ids": "PMID: 26270481",
        "europdx_access_modalities": "Not Applicable",
        "accessibility": "Academia and Industry",
        "contact_name_list": "micetech",
        "contact_email_list": "micetech@jax.org",
        "contact_form_url": "http://tumor.informatics.jax.org/mtbwi/pdxRequest.do?mice=TM01002",
        "source_database_url": "http://tumor.informatics.jax.org/mtbwi/pdxDetails.do?modelID=TM01002"
    }
]

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)

query.value: eq.concordance between xenograft and patient tumour
query.description: Short description of what was compared and what was the result: (e.g. high, good, moderate concordance between xenograft, 'model validated against histological features of same diagnosis' or 'not determined')
List of all passages where validation was performed. Passage 0 correspond to first engraftment
Any technique used to validate PDX against their original patient tumour, including fingerprinting, histology, immunohistochemistry
Validation host mouse strain, following mouse strain nomenclature from MGI JAX

request.description: Quality assurance data related to a model.

response.name: Get quality assurance data for a particular model

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Sample identifier given by the provider
URL where the raw data could be found
Name of the platform technology used to produce the molecular characterization
True or False depending on whether or not there is molecular data for this sample
True or False depending on whether or not the molecular data is restricted (meaning provider need to be contacted directly to get the data from them).

request.description: Information about the molecular data that is available for each sample.

response.name: Get molecular metadata for a particular model

item.name: Treatment

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/patient_treatment_extended?model_id=eq.EMC0073PM&data_source=eq.TRACE&patient_id=eq.PTX-EMC-025&patient_age=eq.50 - 59&patient_sex=eq.female&patient_ethnicity=eq.Not Collected&patient_treatment_status=eq.Treatment naive&histology=eq.Uterine Corpus Myxoid Leiomyosarcoma&treatment=eq.Ifosfamide&response=eq.Progressive Disease&dose=eq.3 g/m2 on days 1, 2 and 3 every 21 days&select=*&order=model_id.asc&offset=0&limit=10

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Anonymous/de-identified provider ID for the patient
Diagnosis at time of collection of the patient tumor
Treatment name. It can be surgery, radiotherapy,  drug name  or drug combination

query.value: eq.3 g/m2 on days 1, 2 and 3 every 21 days

response.name: Get patient treatment data for a particular model
response.body:
[
    {
        "model_id": "EMC0073PM",
        "data_source": "TRACE",
        "patient_id": "PTX-EMC-025",
        "patient_age": "50 - 59",
        "patient_sex": "female",
        "patient_ethnicity": "Not Collected",
        "patient_treatment_status": "Treatment naive",
        "histology": "Uterine Corpus Myxoid Leiomyosarcoma",
        "treatment": "Ifosfamide",
        "response": "Progressive Disease",
        "dose": "3 g/m2 on days 1, 2 and 3 every 21 days"
    }
]

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Diagnosis at time of collection of the patient tumor
Treatment name. It can be surgery, radiotherapy,  drug name  or drug combination

response.name: Get drug dosing data for a particular model

item.description: Treatment data for patients or models. It contains information about the treatment, used dose, and the response.

item.name: Molecular Data

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Sample identifier given by the provider
Changes in the amino acid due to the variant
Genomic consequence of this variant, for example: insertion of a codon caused frameshift variation will be considered frameshift variant
Read depth, the number of times each individual base was sequenced
Allele frequency, the relative frequency of an allele in a population
Location on the genome at which the variant is found
The base seen in the reference genome
The base other than the reference allele seen at the locus
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)

request.description: Mutation data with the model and sample it comes from.

response.name: Get mutation molecular data for a specific sample

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)
Sample identifier given by the provider
The ratio between the number of bases of the mapped reads by the number of bases of a reference
Gene expression value represented in Fragments per kilo base of transcript per million mapped fragments (FPKM)
Gene expression value represented in transcript per million (TPM)
Expresion value captured using Affymetrix arrays
Expresion value captured using Illumina arrays
Z-score representing the gene expression level

request.description: Expression data with the model and sample it comes from.

response.name: Get expression molecular data for a specific sample

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)
Sample identifier given by the provider
Log10 scaled copy number variation ratio
Log2 scaled copy number variation ratio
Details whether there was a gain or loss of function. Categorized into gain, loss
Score predicted using GISTIC tool for the copy number variation
Score predicted using PICNIC algorithm for the copy number variation

request.description: CNA data with the model and sample it comes from.

response.name: Get CNA molecular data for a particular sample

query.description: Full name of the model used by provider
Data source of the model (provider abbreviation)
Sample identifier given by the provider
Presence or absence of the cytogenetic marker

request.description: Cytogenetics data with the model and sample it comes from.

response.name: Get Cytogenetics molecular data for a particular sample

item.description: Molecular data associated to the samples in the models.
